title: Cranberry-Pomegranate Sauce
full_text:
Cranberry-Pomegranate Sauce
Close
Jump to recipe
Cook
15 mins
Active
15 mins
Cooling Time
30 mins
Total
45 mins
Serves
6
to 8 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
12
ounces
fresh or frozen
cranberries
1
cup
pomegranate juice
1
cup
white sugar
3
tablespoons
brown sugar
1
teaspoon
grated
orange zest
1/2
teaspoon
kosher salt
1/2
cup
pomegranate arils
Directions
Place cranberries, pomegranate juice, white sugar, brown sugar, orange zest, and salt in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until berries start to pop, about 10 minutes.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Remove from heat, stir in pomegranate arils, and let cool for 30 minutes. Adjust consistency with water, if needed. Serve immediately or place in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks, reheating prior to serving.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Make-Ahead and Storage
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to two weeks,
